ygData.subject: New paper on Lamarckian Evolution in Morphologically Evolving Robots

Subject: New paper on Lamarckian Evolution in Morphologically Evolving Robots
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=557232056
From: Evert Haasdijk <e.haasdijk@...>


--94eb2c1a8a7643a6560553f199b5
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all,

I'm very pleased to announce (on behalf of Milan Jelisavcic, Rafae=
l Kiesel,
Kyrre Glette, Guszti Eiben and myself) a new paper on Lamarckian =
evolution
of controllers in morphologically evolving robots, which we will =
present at
ECAL 2017.

When robot morphologies evolve, it is unclear to wha=
t extent a parent=E2=80=99s
controller is applicable in the offspring=E2=80=
=99s body. Changes in the morphology
such as the addition or rearrangement =
of actuators can introduce a
usability gap so that the offspring has to lea=
rn how to control its body
itself. In this paper, we investigate how Lamarc=
kian evolution with
CPPN-based indirect encoding of locomotive controllers =
can help bridge this
gap and exploit the parental controllers to bootstrap =
learning.

title: Analysis of Lamarckian Evolution in Morphologically Evolv=
ing Robots
authors: Milan Jelisavcic, Rafael Kiesel, Kyrre Glette, Evert Ha=
asdijk A.E.
Eiben
abstract:
Evolving robot morphologies implies the need fo=
r lifetime learning so that
newborn robots can learn to manipulate their bo=
dies. An individual's
morphology will obviously combine traits of all its p=
arents; it must adapt
its own controller to suit its morphology, and cannot=
 rely on the
controller of any one parent to perform well without adaptatio=
n. This paper
investigates the practicability and benefits of Lamarckian ev=
olution in
this setting. Implementing lifetime learning by means of on-line=
 evolution,
we first establish the suitability of an indirect encoding sche=
me that
combines Compositional Pattern Producing Networks (CPPNs) and Centr=
al
Pattern Generators (CPGs) as a relevant learner and controller for
open-=
loop gait controllers. We then analyze a Lamarckian set-up and the
effect o=
f the parental genetic material on the early convergence to good
locomotion=
 performance.
-- 
Computational Intelligence Group
Computer Science Departm=
ent
Faculty of Sciences - VU University Amsterdam
De Boelelaan 1081a, room =
T3.33
1081 HV  Amsterdam, The Netherlands

T. +31 (0)20 59 87668
M. +31 (0)=
6 2242 3598
DREAM project <http://www.robotsthatdream.eu/>: @robotsthatdrea=
m

VU-disclaimer:
http://www.vu.nl/nl/over-de-vu/vu-website/e-mail-disclaim=
er/disclaimer-tekst-e-mail/

--94eb2c1a8a7643a6560553f199b5
